autograd.core package

Submodules

autograd.core.Graph module

autograd.core.Graph.draw_dot(root, graph_name)

Draw the computation graph using graphviz.

Args:

root: The root Value object representing the starting point of the graph. graph_name: The name of the graph (used as the filename).

Returns:

A Digraph object representing the computation graph.

autograd.core.Graph.trace(root)

Trace the computation graph starting from the root node.

Args:

root: The root Value object representing the starting point of the graph.

Returns:

A tuple containing sets of nodes and edges in the graph.

autograd.core.Spares_nn module

class autograd.core.Spares_nn.Module

Bases: object

parameters()

Return a list of all parameters in the module.

zero_grad()

Set the gradients of all parameters in the module to zero.

autograd.core.engine module

class autograd.core.engine.Value(data=None, _children=(), _op='', label='')

Bases: object

Stores a single scalar value and its gradient.

backward(keep_graph=False)

Perform backpropagation to compute the gradients.

Args:

keep_graph: Whether to keep the computational graph for higher-order gradients.

relu()

Apply the rectified linear unit (ReLU) activation function to the Value object.

Returns:

A new Value object representing the output of ReLU.

softmax()

Apply the softmax activation function to the Value object.

Returns:

A new Value object representing the output of softmax.
